discussion.author: lbilli
discussion.text: Though unregistered, the package has been around for quite some time and I'd find it rather inconvenient to change the name at this stage.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text:
> I'd find it rather inconvenient to change the name at this stage

Sorry, but that's not a convincing argument. `Jib` really isn't a suitable name for a Julia package. Not only is "IB" jargon, the "J" is also for "Julia", and we strongly discourage the "Julia" prefix/suffix for Julia packages (except for some very special cases).

Note that you can write

```
using InteractiveBrokers: InteractiveBrokers as Jib
```

in any existing code (and yes, it would be nice if in some future version of Julia that could be written as `using InteractiveBrokers as Jib`)

discussion.author: lbilli
discussion.text:
That's fair.
I'm not trying to convince anybody or build a case.

Registration has not been a priority of mine but since some user suggested it I thought I'd give it a try.

Feel free to disregard this request.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text:
There is also the option of putting it in a [`LocalRegistry`](https://github.com/GunnarFarneback/LocalRegistry.jl), which will alleviate most of the problems with unregistered packages, except for "packages in General can only have dependencies that are also in General". If that ever becomes the problem, I think you'll have to rename, unfortunately.

> that's not a convincing argument

If you wanted to try a slightly more convincing argument, it would be "I also have `rib` for the R-version of this package, and I'd like to keep a consistent name". But a 3-letter package name is just going to be an extremely tough sell.

> Feel free to disregard this request.

Alright, I'm going to close this here, but don't hesitate to try again in the future. At least with a more suitable name, this package would be more than welcome in General.
